results.title: Levers
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Simple Machines”.
Introduces the concept that the lever is a simple machine which can change the amount of force and distance. Shows such familiar forms of the lever as a see-saw, nutcracker, and broom and examples of more complex machines.

results.title: Letting in the jungle
results.brief_description: A visit to Kolmarden Zoological Park in Sweden where wild animals from all over the world live free in surroundings reminiscent of a national park. Includes a sequence depicting Siberian tigers at play in the snow. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: Letting go
results.creator_credit: Anne Whitehead and Tasmanian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: This drama explores the communication difficulties and differences in values between the generations in a fairly typical Australian family. Conflict reaches a crisis point when the seventeen-year-old daughter decides to leave home and live with her boyfriend. Cast includes: Robyn Nevin, John Ewart, Karena Menzie, Miranda Cartledge, Jeremy Scrivener, Phillip Priest.

results.title: Letters to Ali [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Clara Law, Eddie L.C. Fong and Lunar Films
results.brief_description: Remarkable work, that is part road-movie, about an Australian family who befriend an Afghanistan refugee (via letters), held in Port Hedland, their relationship with him and their attempts to free him. Clara Law (Goddess of 1967) accompanies the family on a 12,000 kilometre round trip taken to visit Ali, exploring the dynamics of the family and laying bare the cruel bureaucracy of the Australian government that holds refugees in detention centres for limitless periods, under dire conditions. A ponderous and significant work that contains moments of beauty whilst conveying the pain and anguish of all involved. Also available on VHS [318951].

results.title: Letters from Poland: Sydney, November, 1950
results.brief_description:
In Sydney in 1950 a young Polish woman waits for the arrival of Tadek, her prospective husband. Working as a night cleaner in a city office, she strikes up a casual friendship with the nightwatchman and waits for Tadek.
Cast features Martin Vaughan. Photography and editing by Martha Ansara.

results.title: Letters from Poland
results.creator_credit: Sophia Turkiewicz, Mark Stiles and AFTRS
results.brief_description: The story of a young Polish immigrant and her struggle to build a new life in the harsh environment of post World War II Sydney. The film raises a number of themes: the loneliness of being in a foreign land; the special isolation of a migrant woman and the dislocation of a single mother needing to support both herself and her child. Cast includes Bashia Bonkowski, Martin Vaughan, Jessica O’Donnell, Arthur Krawczynski, Tracy Ellis. Photography: Martha Ansara

results.title: Letterboxes: the inside story
results.creator_credit: Catherine South and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: An engaging and humorous look at the significance of the letterbox in urban life. The letterboxes we see are of all different shapes and sizes. Their owners tell why they chose them and the impact the mail delivery has on their daily lives.

results.title: Letter to Santa
results.creator_credit: John Davis, Ursula Kolbe and Davis Film and Video Production
results.brief_description: An enchanting puppet story about a country which is desperately short of water. Sally writes to Santa, saying that she will forgo presents this year if he can only make it rain. Santa builds a giant snowball and tows it behind his sleigh all the way to Australia but the snowball is too heavy.
